title: Drawing, "Volcano Puresé and the Rio de Vinagre, Purese, Colombia", August 1853
medium: Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on buff colored paper
markings: Stamped in ink, at lower left:
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite throughout:  Clouds /  w[hite] /  r[eddish] green / grassy / bushes / red / soil / low bushes / maize / yellowish / yellow / rock / corn / grass /  stones / 2; and at top right: 2 maize, dry ;again, at bottom center: All this portion broken into rocks trees, bushes, grass, etc. etc. and of / every variety of tints; and again at bottom left: Volcano of Purese / and Rio de Vinagre / Aug / 53.
description: Horizontal view of the valley with the stream shown in the extreme right foreground and middle ground; a plateau with houses located in the central and left middle ground; and hills and mountain ranges in the background, with the volcano in the left center of the distant background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Volcano Puresé and the Rio de Vinagre, Purese, Colombia", August 1853.
August 1853. Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on buff colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-111.
